Nanoconfinement Science Gateway enables you to:

  • Simulate ions confined between biological and synthetic surfaces that are nanometers apart.
  • Experiment with various ionic and environmental attributes including ion valency and salt concentration.
  • Obtain information about the distribution and assembly of ions in nanoconfinement.
  • Run simulations on IU and XSEDE HPC computational resources.
  • Share your simulation results with your peers.
\"}, \"id\": \"c191fb24-6c53-41cd-8750-39a0201a48f4\"}]", "page": 3}]}

Molecular Dynamics (MD)

Standard MD techniques provide an accurate estimate for the ionic distribution in a system with no dielectric mismatch across surfaces (interfaces). The competition between electrostatic and entropic interactions determines the ionic structure in nanoscale confinement.

\"}, \"id\": \"cc2dddda-44ea-4b18-b5c7-5293897722e3\"}, {\"type\": \"paragraph_block\", \"value\": {\"custom_class\": \"col-md-6 bg-crimson section\", \"body\": \"

Advanced methods are needed to simulate ions near interfaces exhibiting dielectric mismatch. Taking cues from nature, we developed CPMD, a simulation method that enables on-the-fly movement of ions in tandem with the update of the polarized charges induced on the interfaces.

\"}, \"id\": \"0b85eca6-3860-4c6e-9747-a0accfc7fe69\"}]", "page": 3}]}

Standard MD techniques provide an accurate estimate for the ionic distribution in a system with no dielectric mismatch across surfaces (interfaces). The competition between electrostatic and entropic interactions determines the ionic structure in nanoscale confinement.

\"}, \"id\": \"cc2dddda-44ea-4b18-b5c7-5293897722e3\"}, {\"type\": \"paragraph_block\", \"value\": {\"custom_class\": \"col-md-6 bg-crimson section-alt pl-5\", \"body\": \"

Car-Parrinello Molecular Dynamics (CPMD)

Advanced methods are needed to simulate ions near interfaces exhibiting dielectric mismatch. Taking cues from nature, we developed CPMD, a simulation method that enables on-the-fly movement of ions in tandem with the update of the polarized charges induced on the interfaces.

\"}, \"id\": \"0b85eca6-3860-4c6e-9747-a0accfc7fe69\"}]", "page": 3}, {"pk": 6, "sort_order": 5, "body": "[{\"type\": \"paragraph_block\", \"value\": {\"custom_class\": \"col-md-6 section p-5\", \"body\": \"

The simulation results include information that characterize the equilibrium structure of ions in confinement including thermodynamic data and ionic distributions. A sample result produced by the gateway is shown: distributions of ions associated with monovalent (1:1), divalent (2:1), and trivalent (3:1) salt confined between planar interfaces that are 3 nanometers apart.

\"}, \"id\": \"985d474b-2fc8-4e3c-aa3c-2432fdcb88d9\"}, {\"type\": \"image_block\", \"value\": {\"image\": 6, \"caption\": \"\", \"width\": \"100%\", \"height\": null, \"redirect_url\": \"\", \"custom_class\": \"col-md-4 p-5\"}, \"id\": \"0e5e85cd-a10a-4fe2-9129-764f63629088\"}]", "page": 3}]}

{"pk": 3, "path": "000100010001", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Home", "draft_title": "Home", "slug": "home", "content_type": 27, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/home/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "home", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "first_published_at": "2018-04-17T18:06:59.530Z", "last_published_at": "2018-04-17T20:24:03.754Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2018-04-17T20:24:03.714Z", "live_revision": 40, "show_navbar": "yes", "show_nav_extra": "yes", "show_footer": "yes", "row": [{"pk": 1, "sort_order": 0, "body": "[{\"type\": \"image_block\", \"value\": {\"image\": 4, \"caption\": \"\", \"width\": \"\", \"height\": null, \"redirect_url\": \"\", \"custom_class\": \"col-md-12 banner-image no-cf\"}, \"id\": \"121455ce-0030-4c2e-a615-97a2383ca0f8\"}]", "page": 3}, {"pk": 2, "sort_order": 1, "body": "[{\"type\": \"paragraph_block\", \"value\": {\"custom_class\": \"col-md-12 bg-crimson section\", \"body\": \"

Nanoconfinement Science Gateway enables you to:

  • Simulate ions confined between biological and synthetic surfaces that are nanometers apart.
  • Experiment with various ionic and environmental attributes including ion valency and salt concentration.
  • Obtain information about the distribution and assembly of ions in nanoconfinement.
  • Run simulations on IU and XSEDE HPC computational resources.
  • Share your simulation results with your peers.
\"}, \"id\": \"c191fb24-6c53-41cd-8750-39a0201a48f4\"}]", "page": 3}, {"pk": 4, "sort_order": 2, "body": "[{\"type\": \"paragraph_block\", \"value\": {\"custom_class\": \"col-md-8 mx-auto mt-5\", \"body\": \"

A snapshot showing induced density map produced during a CPMD simulation (center) on one of the interfaces as a result of the instantaneous configuration of ions confined between the two interfaces (left). The induced charges in CPMD match with the exact values (right) signalling the success of the on-the-fly simulation.

\"}, \"id\": \"be53a096-a406-41ce-a5a4-dfe9581befc2\"}]", "page": 3}, {"pk": 3, "sort_order": 3, "body": "[{\"type\": \"image_block\", \"value\": {\"image\": 5, \"caption\": \"\", \"width\": \"100%\", \"height\": null, \"redirect_url\": \"\", \"custom_class\": \"col-md-8 mx-auto mt-3\"}, \"id\": \"e5ebafb4-ed42-4af8-aac0-c2b94e11533c\"}]", "page": 3}, {"pk": 5, "sort_order": 4, "body": "[{\"type\": \"paragraph_block\", \"value\": {\"custom_class\": \"col-md-6 bg-crimson section\", \"body\": \"

Molecular Dynamics (MD)

Standard MD techniques provide an accurate estimate for the ionic distribution in a system with no dielectric mismatch across surfaces (interfaces). The competition between electrostatic and entropic interactions determines the ionic structure in nanoscale confinement.

\"}, \"id\": \"cc2dddda-44ea-4b18-b5c7-5293897722e3\"}, {\"type\": \"paragraph_block\", \"value\": {\"custom_class\": \"col-md-6 bg-crimson section-alt pl-5\", \"body\": \"

Car-Parrinello Molecular Dynamics (CPMD)

Advanced methods are needed to simulate ions near interfaces exhibiting dielectric mismatch. Taking cues from nature, we developed CPMD, a simulation method that enables on-the-fly movement of ions in tandem with the update of the polarized charges induced on the interfaces.

\"}, \"id\": \"0b85eca6-3860-4c6e-9747-a0accfc7fe69\"}]", "page": 3}, {"pk": 6, "sort_order": 5, "body": "[{\"type\": \"paragraph_block\", \"value\": {\"custom_class\": \"col-md-6 section-2 p-5\", \"body\": \"

The simulation results include information that characterize the equilibrium structure of ions in confinement including thermodynamic data and ionic distributions. A sample result produced by the gateway is shown: distributions of ions associated with monovalent (1:1), divalent (2:1), and trivalent (3:1) salt confined between planar interfaces that are 3 nanometers apart.

\"}, \"id\": \"985d474b-2fc8-4e3c-aa3c-2432fdcb88d9\"}, {\"type\": \"image_block\", \"value\": {\"image\": 6, \"caption\": \"\", \"width\": \"100%\", \"height\": null, \"redirect_url\": \"\", \"custom_class\": \"col-md-4 p-5\"}, \"id\": \"0e5e85cd-a10a-4fe2-9129-764f63629088\"}]", "page": 3}, {"pk": 7, "sort_order": 6, "body": "[{\"type\": \"paragraph_block\", \"value\": {\"custom_class\": \"col-md-12 bg-crimson section\", \"body\": \"

Contact Information:

The Nanoconfinement Science Gateway is operated by Suresh Marru and Vikram Jadhao.

Lab Website https://jadhaolab.engineering.indiana.edu/

Email: smarru at iu.edu, vjadhao at iu.edu

The Gateway is based on Apache Airavata developed and supported by the IU Science Gateways Research Center.

\"}, \"id\": \"8aef560e-6472-4353-8e31-e1b3901650f7\"}]", "page": 3}, {"pk": 8, "sort_order": 7, "body": "[{\"type\": \"paragraph_block\", \"value\": {\"custom_class\": \"col-md-10 section-2\", \"body\": \"

References:

The following publications describe the nanoconfinement simulation methods and provide useful background.

  • Jing, Yufei, Vikram Jadhao, Jos W. Zwanikken, and Monica Olvera de la Cruz. "Ionic structure in liquids confined by dielectric interfaces." The Journal of Chemical Physics 143, no. 19 (2015): 194508.
  • Vikram Jadhao, Francisco J. Solis, and Monica Olvera de la Cruz. "A variational formulation of electrostatics in a medium with spatially varying dielectric permittivity" The Journal of Chemical Physics, 138, (2013): 054119.
  • Vikram Jadhao, Francisco J. Solis, and Monica Olvera de la Cruz. "Simulation of charged systems in heterogeneous dielectric media via a true energy functional" Physical Review Letters, 109, no. 22 (2012): 223905.
\"}, \"id\": \"96ec9c92-000e-467d-9749-d6939e4fd4bd\"}]", "page": 3}]}

[{"type": "paragraph_block", "value": {"custom_class": "col-md-12 bg-crimson section", "body": "

Nanoconfinement Science Gateway enables you to:

  • Simulate ions confined between biological and synthetic surfaces that are nanometers apart.
  • Experiment with various ionic and environmental attributes including ion valency and salt concentration.
  • Obtain information about the distribution and assembly of ions in nanoconfinement.
  • Run simulations on IU and XSEDE HPC computational resources.
  • Share your simulation results with your peers.
"}, "id": "c191fb24-6c53-41cd-8750-39a0201a48f4"}]

[{"type": "paragraph_block", "value": {"custom_class": "col-md-8 mx-auto mt-5", "body": "

A snapshot showing induced density map produced during a CPMD simulation (center) on one of the interfaces as a result of the instantaneous configuration of ions confined between the two interfaces (left). The induced charges in CPMD match with the exact values (right) signalling the success of the on-the-fly simulation.

"}, "id": "be53a096-a406-41ce-a5a4-dfe9581befc2"}]

[{"type": "paragraph_block", "value": {"custom_class": "col-md-6 bg-crimson section", "body": "

Molecular Dynamics (MD)

Standard MD techniques provide an accurate estimate for the ionic distribution in a system with no dielectric mismatch across surfaces (interfaces). The competition between electrostatic and entropic interactions determines the ionic structure in nanoscale confinement.

"}, "id": "cc2dddda-44ea-4b18-b5c7-5293897722e3"}, {"type": "paragraph_block", "value": {"custom_class": "col-md-6 bg-crimson section-alt pl-5", "body": "

Car-Parrinello Molecular Dynamics (CPMD)

Advanced methods are needed to simulate ions near interfaces exhibiting dielectric mismatch. Taking cues from nature, we developed CPMD, a simulation method that enables on-the-fly movement of ions in tandem with the update of the polarized charges induced on the interfaces.

"}, "id": "0b85eca6-3860-4c6e-9747-a0accfc7fe69"}]

[{"type": "paragraph_block", "value": {"custom_class": "col-md-6 section-2 p-5", "body": "

The simulation results include information that characterize the equilibrium structure of ions in confinement including thermodynamic data and ionic distributions. A sample result produced by the gateway is shown: distributions of ions associated with monovalent (1:1), divalent (2:1), and trivalent (3:1) salt confined between planar interfaces that are 3 nanometers apart.

"}, "id": "985d474b-2fc8-4e3c-aa3c-2432fdcb88d9"}, {"type": "image_block", "value": {"image": 6, "caption": "", "width": "100%", "height": null, "redirect_url": "", "custom_class": "col-md-4 p-5"}, "id": "0e5e85cd-a10a-4fe2-9129-764f63629088"}]

"}, "id": "8aef560e-6472-4353-8e31-e1b3901650f7"}]
